{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is at 10 weeks gestation and is feeling well with no alarming symptoms. The physical exam is also within normal limits. At this stage, invasive procedures like amniocentesis or chorionic villus sampling are not indicated unless there is a high risk of genetic abnormalities, which is not mentioned in the case. Cell-free DNA testing is also usually reserved for high-risk pregnancies.
